articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as India play South Africa in the Men's Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: India bat first against SA in clash of top two

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta calls the video assistant referee's decision to allow Newcastle's goal in their 1-0 win "embarrassing" and a "disgrace".
articles.title: 'Sick' Arteta fumes at Newcastle VAR goal 'disgrace'

articles.description: England's swagger has gone over the past four weeks as Australia happily strike the final blow to their World Cup defence in Ahmedabad.
articles.title: 'More misery heaped on prickly and subdued England'

articles.description: Harry Kane's incredible start to life at Bayern Munich continues with his third Bundesliga hat-trick in an impressive win at Borussia Dortmund.
articles.title: Kane hits hat-trick in big Bayern win at Dortmund

articles.description: Many people within F1 feel that the current sprint format is not working but it is not clear how it may change, writes Andrew Benson.
articles.title: 'Consensus within F1 that sprint format needs to change - but how?'

articles.description: Jessica Pegula beats US Open champion and doubles partner Coco Gauff to secure her place in the final of the season-ending WTA Finals in Mexico.
articles.title: Pegula thrashes Gauff to reach final at WTA Finals

articles.description: Match of the Day's Danny Murphy and Martin Keown discuss whether VAR should have ruled out Anthony Gordan's goal that gave Newcastle a 1-0 win over Arsenal at St James' Park.
articles.title: Match of the Day: Should Newcastle's goal have stood?

articles.description: The home of FA Cup Video on BBC Sport online. Includes the latest news stories, results, fixtures, video and audio.
articles.title: FA Cup Video highlights - BBC Sport

articles.description: Joe Cordina successfully defends his IBF super-featherweight title with a hard-fought majority decision victory over Edward Vazquez in Monte Carlo.
articles.title: Cordina retains title with majority decision win

articles.description: Emma Hayes is close to being confirmed as manager of the United States Women's national team and could become the world's highest paid female coach.
articles.title: Hayes close to being named US women's manager
